revised_title: Studying Instability of Flows in Spatially Developing Media
tldr: This article investigates the instability of flows in media with spatially varying properties. The authors develop a method to find series solutions for the amplitude evolution of disturbances and apply it to the Ginzburg-Landau equation, a model for instability growth in fluid-dynamical systems. They find criteria for the onset of global instability and discuss the implications of their findings.
